channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 7 out of 10 employees dangerously underestimate or overestimate their skill levels, new analysis finds
item.description: The 'unknown unknowns' come at the highest cost: Employees who overestimate their skills and have gaps that prevent confident and safe task execution.

item.title: Supreme Court ‘Ghost Guns’ Case Has Major Implications for an Industry in Flux

item.title: A Goldman Sachs job is a ‘golden ticket’—over 300,000 young bankers try to get one each year
item.description: Applicants need to show sincerity when applying for Goldman’s intern program, which accepts fewer than 1% of applicants

item.title: Trump’s Plans Could Increase U.S. Debt While Raising Costs for Most Americans
item.description: A new analysis estimates that the former president’s proposals could grow deficits by as much as $15 trillion over a decade.

item.title: What to Know About the 2024 Nobel Prizes
item.description: The annual prizes are being announced this week, beginning Monday.

item.title: No One Said It Was Going to Be Easy for Kamala Harris
item.description: But tell me again why she isn’t running away with this election?

item.title: Israelis Mourn Nova Music Festival Victims
item.description: Families of the victims organized the dawn memorial ceremony at the Re’im forest one year after the Hamas-led Oct. 7 attack on Israel.

item.title: Operational leadership in companies and the Supreme Court
item.description: The COO role is making a comeback, often combined with other roles, as companies look for operational excellence.

item.title: A Hundred Years’ War for Our Time
item.description: Peace in the Middle East seems more elusive than ever, with Oct. 7 setting off a battle over not just land but the narrative itself.

item.title: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine Is Awarded to Victor Ambros and Gary Ruvkun
item.description: The prize was awarded for their discovery of microRNA and its role in post-transcriptional gene regulation.
